intro: Lagascea pteropoda, commonly known as the common lagascea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Due to its delicate structure and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
